depict; symbolise

Bào Jiāo 鮑焦 (5th century) is celebrated in Warring States literature as a moralist recluse who committed suicide in disgust over the sordid state of the world as he saw it. [XINXU 3.74] [ZHUANG 29; ZGC Yan 1; HSWZ 1.25, 1.27, 7.6; SY17.17; XINXU 7.26; QIANFULUN 5.9; FSTY 2] Unger, Prosopography no. 546
be well-disposed towards support emotionally; have loving feelings towards and take loving care of (superiors)
show intimate loving concern for, feel close to
be unrealistic

tls:text.tls:line: "Alas,

sense.def: (this) is tragic! (this) is a pity! [Note that it appears that the omission of the subject is idiomatic, if not obligatory. Hence vi(0).]

tls:text.tls:line: How can the person who does not know how to pattern himself after Heaven

sense.def: how to, using what (the subject) V-s

tls:text.tls:line: if you would hold to the way of fullness,

sense.def: 持盈守成"safeguard the plenitude of what one has and safeguard what one has achieved": maintain and safeguard the plenitude of one's achievements without aiming for more than can be safely maintained.

tls:text.tls:line: there was no way they could make use [of these things].

sense.def: be not of use for anything, be of no use; be useless
